content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
												I haven't been playing long so if you need to decide if you are going to get this game, look to a review from someone who has spent at least 30 hrs in game.I am here to share my first impressions. I'll start with the bad: the game is very cookie cutter, story line, level grind, being usless untill level 20, and so on. I have also seen better graphics, WAY BETTER. The game also feels frustratingly easy, but takes a long  time. It's like every other F2P MMO out there. BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE!Now for the good stuff; the game is adorable, the npc's have funny personalities, It's quick to understand, and really fun, almost relaxing. But what is really unique about this game is the community. I was playing for the first time trying to figure out what to do and bam, in the first FIVE minutes I met three people (all higher level than me) just hanging around, who invited me to their party. Two minutes later they where going on all my quests with me and showing me what to do. They helped me until I reached lvl 10 when I had to get off and catch some sleep. We have keept in touch since then but it's really cool how I met them so soon and how friendly they where, I'm used to playing games where nearly everyone is "lone wolf" kinda thing but It's really nice to have people to party up with and just hang out.I'm keeping this short and sweet so overall first impression is: I'm No longer forever alone. This game is fun, have some paitience, give it a try :P.

Posted: August 22, 2013
												Dragon Nest is and MMO RPG based game set in an great looking world this game delivers alot of action alot of quest and you can have various things to do their is always a guild to join and their is always someone to play with. I have tried running this game on ultra and it looks very good when playing this game I recommend you try running it on normal and up. Also their is a market place system on here so check that out when you get over 1K gold. From a scale on 1-10 I would give this game a 7/10.Dragon Nest may have it's moments such as having lag at some points or your screen may go black from time to time.I recommend this game for people that want to play a cartoon based MMO it is very fun and can be a bit addictive but most of all it's about teaming up and kicking♥♥♥♥♥ The animation in this game is down right and good I love how the senes come up and when their over their's even more action and fighting missions in this game take a while to complete and every year they add up the level max by 10. I am currently a level 56 but the level cap is now 70. In this game you can really play for a very long time and not get board. I think what makes this MMO diffrent from others is the charcters and how they look.+Warrior+Archer+Cleric+KaliAre my top 4 favorite charcters I recommend these guys because they really get the job done they kill Swift and Clean and they are really easy to control. during the begining of the game you are introduced to a wonderful world each character has a diffrent cutsene inn the start of the game. But they all really come together and you won't really realize it. I recommend that you team up with other people at least 2 or 3 but a party of 4 is also good too. When playing Dragon Nest it is always good for your party's characters to be diffrent. Their is no fun in having a party of 4 and all of you guys are warriors. Every character is diffrent and they all have their own special abilities so make a wise choice. When starting out you will be a bit confused so help is always needed your can ask people to train you but they might want you to be a certain level before they begin to help you out. Having a Mentor is always good because they can power level you when you need them the most. Weapons and Armor in this game are really good. The equipment you start out with is ind of crappy but as you progress in this game you will unlock some really good stuff. If you want to get a bit fancy with your Weapons and Armor you can buy soome NX in the game and get and outfits,pets,weapons, and other accesories. This game is really good you should really try it out you will learn how to play right away the customization on here is great and the graphics are really good so check it out and good luck on your travels. Dragon Nest delivers a great set of music when  you are in town and when you are in battle. The bosses in this game can be difficult if you don't know what your doing I give this game a 7/10

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												First off, I'd like to say that I'm not a huge fan of MMO's, but I do attempt some to see how I like them. And this one I absolutely fell in love with. It's got great gameplay (feels more like 3rd person action than an MMO, which I like) with some awesome abilities you can gain, a pretty good story that actually goes in depth, compared to some other MMO's I've played, and actually has some characters that you grow to care for. Not to mention that the style is very nice, along with the designs of most of the weapons and armor.The ONLY issue I would have to say (but this could be said about other games as well), is that when you get to higher levels, like 45+, you will need to grind so much XP, it can be a bit teadious. But, if you have a group of friends, or can make some new ones on here, then you can go do some nice raids, and high level grinding, and that'll help out a bit. Otherwise, this game is pretty awesome, and I've enjoy every moment I've spent playing it.

												This game is a fun and challenging action MMO set up with a fast-paced dungeon crawling experiance and a great social community. The camera is third person so you always feel like your in the action, with movement being in the WASD, The free to play system is fair and does NOT really affect balance between players, i.e. pay to win situation. Most of your money goes into cosmetics anywa. Plus the game runs, and looks great! I do recommend that you play with friends and take on harder, but more rewarding challenges. A lot of fun is to be had with friends. The only thing that may be discouraging is that you can't choose the specific sex you want to play as for each class. So if you want to be a female, warrior-brute, sorry :/  I didn't have any big gripes with that though. I would say go in, pick your play style, and have fun!

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												To preface about myself, I've been playing this game since beta, and have well over 500 hours logged on this, since the switch to using Steam for Dragon Nest was relatively recent.I have a great time playing this game. It recently got revamped to make leveling from 1-50 easier, although it will still take time. It's definitely possible to finish the story line with just the gear you get from quests, although getting really good gear will definitely take time and in-game currency. While there are people who trade NX for gold and vice versa, this game is most definitely not pay 2 win, but there are many costumes and cosmetic customizations that you can purchase within the NX store. While those cosmetic items do indeed have stats, they're definitely not needed to be well-geared for raids. Class elitism doesn't exist for the most common things, such as nests, although once you start getting into raids and other really tough things to clear, people will definitely have class preferences. That said, it's good to visit the forums on dragonnest.nexon.net and read about different classes, as well as do some googling on what's easiest to gear, what class is cheapest to get good at, etc, before jumping into this game. Most people I've met were extremely friendly, and it's never hard to party up and work with people for nests and quests. Guilds are also awesome in this game. There are many, and different types exist for different players, so everyone from casual to hardcore can find guilds to suit them. The market is also really well done now, and buying/selling is a smooth process.The fighting system is real-time and 3D, which makes for an AWESOME gameplay. It's super fast and has pve and pvp within the game, with reward systems and ability to acquire weapons by doing either. It's not all about stats - your ability to dodge monsters' abilities, other people's abilities, and the whole cartoon animation style is great. The one con that I would mention is that once you get really high level and your power runs out quickly, the game can get somewhat boring unless you have a guild or a group of friends to do raids and nests with. Being purely a solo player is a lonesome and boring life once you hit 70, and grinding does exist for the last 10-15 levels until you hit the cap. Overall I'd rate this game 8.5/10. It's solid,

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2014
												First off- the most important thing is: the most fun I have had in a game since I was about ~12 (I'm 27, and i'm talking about FF7). The action in this game is... amazing. Fast paced, intense, and above all it's just fun.Also, character progression is great. Each class specs into 2 different tiers, and from there 2 more, etc. This, combined with the fact that you can spend your points on different abilities, means you can have 2 people from the class performing different roles and adds uniqueness (kinda) and flexibility. Each new ability you unlock can be dramatic, and the best part is you can pump points into any of them depending on how you want to play your character. I hate when games have the useful skills and the useless ones, and it's just a no brainer.Unfortuantely (and this may have changed since i last played- let me know if it has) the in-game economy is set to nickel and dime you to death. I played up to level cap (when it was 50). Each new level they give you items to seal your good equip/items (thus allowing you to sell on the player2player market, otherwise your item is tied to your character). But as soon as you reach level cap, you get no more of these. This means, once you are out, as i was, you have to pay a ridiculous price for these seals. I can't remember what the price was, but it was ludicrous. There are free ones you collect in the game, but after playing for hours upon hours (i think my game time was arounf 172 hours?) i blew all of them and got maybe a few to work, if that. The rate of success on these free ones was so low, and the price of the paid ones so high, that it wasn't worth playing anymore because I essentially couldn't make a decent amount of money and i certainly didn't want to ditch my epic gear to an in game store for pennies. I sincerely hope that has changed since i stopped, but i doubt it has. Let me know though if it has, because i would LOVE to pick this game up again.Also, i only dabbled in the PVP, but it was very good from what i played.If this game had an option to buy it outright for a set price ($60? i would pay more even...) and just let you buy and sell freely in the market, maybe with some other options, it would be in my top 10 games ever, imho.All in all, i would highly recommend playing this game- only with the foresight of knowing not to let yourself get addicted, only to have withdrawals when you force yourself off of it at level cap (when things get really interesting). Or maybe even play to level cap, and then start a new character.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2014
												First off- the most important thing is: the most fun I have had in a game since I was about ~12 (I'm 27, and i'm talking about FF7). The action in this game is... amazing. Fast paced, intense, and above all it's just fun.Also, character progression is great. Each class specs into 2 different tiers, and from there 2 more, etc. This, combined with the fact that you can spend your points on different abilities, means you can have 2 people from the class performing different roles and adds uniqueness (kinda) and flexibility. Each new ability you unlock can be dramatic, and the best part is you can pump points into any of them depending on how you want to play your character. I hate when games have the useful skills and the useless ones, and it's just a no brainer.Unfortuantely (and this may have changed since i last played- let me know if it has) the in-game economy is set to nickel and dime you to death. I played up to level cap (when it was 50). Each new level they give you items to seal your good equip/items (thus allowing you to sell on the player2player market, otherwise your item is tied to your character). But as soon as you reach level cap, you get no more of these. This means, once you are out, as i was, you have to pay a ridiculous price for these seals. I can't remember what the price was, but it was ludicrous. There are free ones you collect in the game, but after playing for hours upon hours (i think my game time was arounf 172 hours?) i blew all of them and got maybe a few to work, if that. The rate of success on these free ones was so low, and the price of the paid ones so high, that it wasn't worth playing anymore because I essentially couldn't make a decent amount of money and i certainly didn't want to ditch my epic gear to an in game store for pennies. I sincerely hope that has changed since i stopped, but i doubt it has. Let me know though if it has, because i would LOVE to pick this game up again.Also, i only dabbled in the PVP, but it was very good from what i played.If this game had an option to buy it outright for a set price ($60? i would pay more even...) and just let you buy and sell freely in the market, maybe with some other options, it would be in my top 10 games ever, imho.All in all, i would highly recommend playing this game- only with the foresight of knowing not to let yourself get addicted, only to have withdrawals when you force yourself off of it at level cap (when things get really interesting). Or maybe even play to level cap, and then start a new character.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												I love this game. Honestly, when I first saw it, I thought it was going to be like all of the other MMORPGs. Basic few classes, leveling, lack of people, and then get bored maybe a week or two into it, but I have been playing for over a year now, and I think it's awesome. There are not only 7 different classes with another on the way to choose from, but each class gets a subclass at level 15, and then it splits yet again into more customization at level 45. There is no lack of players, either. There are multiple channels filled with players in all of the different cities. Party play is fun and the dungeons are expansive. I absolutely recommend this game to the MMO players out there. If you've ever played Vindictus, it has a similiar game-play, but a bit more anime-esque. Try it!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												Although this game can have some problems. Mainly with Hack-Shield. Once you get it working, have fun with your addiction. This game is pure fun. I can't get enough. The developers goal was to basically combine console level Hack'n'Slash gameplay with traditional MMORPG features. And it worked. It worked so well. The character customization is a bit lacking, but it is still there. The game is not a money sucker by any means. When they same Free-to-play, they mean free to play. The graphics overall are not the greatest, even on max settings. But as long as you are not a graphics Wh*** you should be fine. But overall, the graphic style is very nice. It's bright-ish Anime inspired graphics are not exactly new to the MMO genre, but overall are nice. I haven't even gotten to the Combat. Oh my, I can not get enough of this gameplay. The combat is absolutely gorgeous. It has your basic left-click attack. Your right click is your special. And then you have your skills, the skills are respectivly on the number keys, which does take a little while to get use to at first. But after awhile it won't be so irritating.The music in this game is also quite beautiful, and works perfectly in the background to build tension. It is no Kingdom Hearts or Elder Scrolls, but it is still quite nice. The composers did a nice job. Gameplay 9.7Sound 8.8Graphics 7.6Replay value 10Overall 8.9/10~RadiantNight7

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												I'm going to say it right now: this game is  VERY  "grindy." If you plan on getting the  decent  gear or that top pvp ladder spot you better be ready to grind those dungeons till your eyes bleed. It is very much a grind-to-win game. And is the very standard "Collect X amounts of stuff" MMO crap that we have come to enjoy (sarcasm). The story is mediocre at best. Customer support is quite possible one of the worst, as the publisher is Nexon.That being said though, it still has it's great moments. If you just sit back and ignore all of those fancy collectables and pvp lags, you will realize that it can be enjoyable. The skills and classes are very diverse and offer a lot of interesting combos and techniques to play around with in both pvp and pve. The community (for the most part) is friendly and willing to help you if need be. And the variety of enemies the game throws at you keeps pve challenging and engaging.5.5/10 This game barely edges out on my scale. Do not play this game unless you like running the same dungeon repeatedly because you will not like it. However, if you are truly just in it for the experience and not the competitiveness, it can still be an entertaining game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												Dragon NestImmediately the art style drew me to this game, so I tried it out. Dragon Nest has a wide variety of classes, each with stats that resemble that class which makes realistic gameplay. It also has a great levelling system, quest system, inventory and arena systems, alongside guilds, as well as parties with fair loot drops for its members. The varied weapons, gear and other items always gives you incentive to keep playing. With its fast action 3rd person gameplay, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes fast paced MMORPG's. This game breaks away from the top down MMO’s and does it well. Overall an amazing game for the solo player or the team player.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												Amazing action MMO that delivers quite a bit of content. Starter classes branch into more elaborate and specialized paths that only enhance the enjoyment of the game. Although the game is based around instances/dungeons, the action and varied monsters make up for the lack of an open world. Can't seem to find any other game that deliver the same action as this game. The cutesy anime graphics may put off some potential players, but for those who do not mind the anime-like graphics will find this game enjoyable. Dungeons/instances are always more fun with friends, but solo play is still pretty fun to play through. A very recommended game for those who seek a true action MMO. ^_^

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												I'm going to say it right now: this game is  VERY  "grindy." If you plan on getting the  decent  gear or that top pvp ladder spot you better be ready to grind those dungeons till your eyes bleed. It is very much a grind-to-win game. And is the very standard "Collect X amounts of stuff" MMO crap that we have come to enjoy (sarcasm). The story is mediocre at best. Customer support is quite possible one of the worst, as the publisher is Nexon.That being said though, it still has it's great moments. If you just sit back and ignore all of those fancy collectables and pvp lags, you will realize that it can be enjoyable. The skills and classes are very diverse and offer a lot of interesting combos and techniques to play around with in both pvp and pve. The community (for the most part) is friendly and willing to help you if need be. And the variety of enemies the game throws at you keeps pve challenging and engaging.5.5/10 This game barely edges out on my scale. Do not play this game unless you like running the same dungeon repeatedly because you will not like it. However, if you are truly just in it for the experience and not the competitiveness, it can still be an entertaining game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												Dragon NestImmediately the art style drew me to this game, so I tried it out. Dragon Nest has a wide variety of classes, each with stats that resemble that class which makes realistic gameplay. It also has a great levelling system, quest system, inventory and arena systems, alongside guilds, as well as parties with fair loot drops for its members. The varied weapons, gear and other items always gives you incentive to keep playing. With its fast action 3rd person gameplay, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes fast paced MMORPG's. This game breaks away from the top down MMO’s and does it well. Overall an amazing game for the solo player or the team player.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												This MMORPG is absolutely addicting!! It is pretty fast paced and action packed to the gills, some drawbacks to the game that Ive had are those pesky SPEED HACKS... I would be in the middle of a dungeon then all of a sudden I get kicked from the game... Atleast I am a patient person so I boot it back up when it happens, so its not a big deal for me. I havent been big on PVP on any game but I decided to have a go with it, it seems that in order to have a good PVP match, you have to be at a high level such as lvl 60... when I first became lvl 24 and was able to get to Saints Haven I tried the PVP, I couldnt find a single person at my lvl to pvp with, it was kind of a let down on that part. The customization is lacking quite a bit, all of the characters are gender locked, so if you want a female warrior then you are out of luck. On the plus side of things, I managed to use a handeld gamepad for this game and it managed to work pretty well, although it lacks the ability to hold more spells and skills than the game allows. The graphics are quite pleasing, and the sound is fun!! I highly recommend this game to anybody who likes fast paced mmorpg's!!

content:
Posted: June 12, 2014
												Great MMORPG. For me, it was my first experience with a game like this. Mainly because it was 3D. :3 Don't judge me. Anyways, it was a beautiful game with fast and stylish combat as well as vivid characters and decent humour. I suggest you give it a try until the end. The main problems for me when playing is that, the game is quite slow and tedious. At the beginning, of course this shows the most but as you progress through, entering each area and doing each quest was indeed slow. It was worthwhile though because you were awarded with rewards. I still recommend this game for all ages. I have friends playing this game from as young as 10 to 30 xD. 8.5/10 Great combat and story.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2013
												The best of both worlds! Action and RPG elements. This isn't your traditional MMORPG! Great anime style graphics, overly steroided monsters and tons of bouncy goodness. One of the few free to play games where you don't get stuck until you spend money in the online store. Without spending a penny you have access to the full game. This game is highly recommended for people who have become jaded with the standard World of Warcraft clones out there. You can actually make real progress playing an hour at a time instead of having to organize a raid that takes 8-10 hours of nonstop game play. Even the largest dungeon takes an hour or less.

content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
												Fun and intense, true free fighting Dragon Nest is one of my favorite MMO's that are free to play. Its diverse fighting is one of the best little features in the game. Anime style graphics make this game look great. When your fighting you will definatley feel like you are breaking the earth. Only setbacks of this game is it is gender locked and that there isnt very much character customization. Sooner or later though NA (North America) will get more classes such as the Assassin which is Dragon Nests' biggest project at the minute. The Assassin is only available in its birth place, Korea, and is based on what his name is, an assassin. Very good game, despite those bad features the game looks great and is very fun and addicting.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Very fun game with a decent storyline. Had hours of fun staying up late with a friend online, destroying enemies with the MMO's fluid combat system and teaming up with random players. Fun experience overall while with friends or some random player. Community is generally friendly, and reading the world chat offers up some good laughs or WTF moments from time to time. I would recommend to any of my friends as it is F2P and you aren't limited by the need to pay unless you REALLY suck at the game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												Action packed RPG with tonnes of nuianced, creative, and just plain fun game play.  Beautiful in game art and cutscenes.  Some of the best writing, storylines, and NPC character development I have seen in forever. Immense in scope and pursuable quests. Clever crafting, character building, market system, and social interaction. Dragon Nest is an easter egg on Steam that it seems few people know about and part of me doesnt want to share, but the people who make this game possible should have their coffers lined with gold for such a well made excellently written and enjoyable game. Suggestion:1. Don't be afraid of challenging and even angering some players with impossible to beat quests.Abyss difficulty at any character level of play should be nigh impossible without a team no matter how good you, equipment, and teammates are. Inscrutable difficulty wins respect, is the best pr, and get the most diehard loyal fans which this truly great game deserves in spades.Likers Like. Haters gonna hate. Gamers, play this game and you will have fun.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												Another online game by Nexon that is similar to Vindictus, but definately different.  Dragon Nest has a bit more of an RPG feel to it than Vindictus. The control is a bit different and resembles more like a mix of Vindictus and Guild Wars 2. However like other free online RPGs, its not really MMO, and its not very open world.  Missions are fun, but NPCs make you do them over and over. 4 character classes to choose from (again gender locked), Fighter(Male), Cleric,(Male) Archer(Elf fFemale), and sorceress (Female).  At upper levels you get class changes and take different class specializations.  Lots of fun, but you will tire of it if you play too much.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2013
												Action MMO that does so much perfectly. Where I live (US) the game feels fluid, no lag, no delay on when I press a move do I see my character reacting. This feeling is so importnant and most games fail to deliver on this. The game is a little micro transaction heavy. Simple things that should be free or earned (like inv space, respecs) are pay for. Also costume items have stats so while they aren't make or break good, they do give a serious boost when added up. One other thing that could be considered bad is some of the best stuff (like big wings that make you run faster) can only be obtained via "Dragon Eggs" which are pay for booster packs that contain a random item. This makes it very cool when you get something but also makes you hesitate to buy an egg, becuase it could be a whammy. Overall the gameplay is awesome, story is very random and anime-like. Lots of fun even if you stay away from the pay shop.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												Heavily stylized, varried gameplay, visually interesting enemies, action-rpg elements, and a system that allows for the building of 'relationships' with NPC's and their factions through an NPC gifting system*, knowledgable and friendly community - What more could you want from an Action-RPG MMO? If you want more 'realism' in your art style check Vindictus - themeatically similar elements and familiar Action-RPG gameplay.Accessable, Free to Play, less of a grind and more of a light hearted good time.If the art style is the only thing stoping you from checking it out - to each their own. Check out Vindictus instead, another F2P light hearted title from the same publisher. *The NPC/Faction/Renown gifting system is incredibly grindy, the gifts are relatively common drops but you need hundreds upon hundreds to make an impact.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												This is unlike any other MMO that is currently on the market. It features crazy fast, arcade-like action mixed with the strategy and planning of an MMO. It has a very engaging story that makes your decisions in quests feel like they matter with great humor scattered throughout the whole thing.In addition to this, all of the content is free. You don't have to buy your levels or your raids, you only buy cosmetic items. And while those cosmetics offer special bonuses for characters which are helpful, they don't impact the game in such a way that it turns it into "pay to win". Would play with friends.Would play solo.Would recomend for anyone.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2015
												So far, I love this game! The classes are all quite unique both in skills and in personality, with each class having their own specializations that change up their playstyles even further. The community, as I've experienced it, has been mostly nice, though you shouldn't expect people to be always there to party up for something. Dungeons, which are your main way of leveling up alongside quests, can get repetetive since there are only around ~3-4 in each area, with each one having ~4-5 different areas inside. Quests, if you actually read into them instead of spamming the space bar to skip the dialogue, generally have a great amount of personality to them, with many, many puns and jokes and such involved in many! Overall, I'd recommend playing this game with friends since it enhances just about everything you do.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												Dragon Nest is Asian made action targeting MMORPG that is free to play.Cons: -The classes are gender locked and no customization.  -The avatar artwork is asian style munchkins.-The graphics are outdated.Personally, i was Not impressed with the game enough to play more.  Need to get back to playing my games that i have paid for like LOTRO, STO, DDO, and SWTOR.  I am sure someone might like this game, give it a try.Play Style/Game Playfull control of the players movement using the keys "W, A, S, D".  Skills using the short cut keys "1-10".  Dragon nest consists of 2 game modes or 2 of both, PvP and PvE. You start off as PvE but later through the levels you can change to PvP or do both. The game consists of 8 Characters as Classes of which they have their own unique skills and abilities. Classes have 'specialization' where they can change into their first and second job and focus on that particular area of combat. Specialization are granted at level 15 and level 44. The 8 classes include:WarriorArcherClericSorceress TinkererKaliAssassinLancerFor more information of the classes and what specialisations they have go to the Nexon website @ http://dragonnest.nexon.net/guides/class-guide  for more info:

content:
Posted: January 18
												This hit hit the spot four years ago when I was looking for a non targeting action brawler with an archer class.. Recently trying new games that might be like it and ended up getting back into this again.  It's a great game and I've only really gotten about half way through the story and the side quests are endless.  As for people complaining it's too easy and you level up too quick, you can be a level 93 and still have lower level gear to make lower level missions more difficult.  Kind of a dumb complaint.  Honestly great game for free and it can totally be played at your own pace, leveling and crafting gear can be addicting so it's tough to have self control if you want to play levels with level appropriate gear..  This is probably one of the first games I reviewed so It's really good imo.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2014
												Just another awful F2P Korean MMO clone of a clone of a clone.  The graphics are on par with PS2 B-grade titles, but the game still stutters like crazy due to the Tera / Zelda style realtime action combat.  The worst part of the game are the zones.  They're as big as a closet and you're required to battle about ~25 enemies at once.  There is no room to manuever or do anything other than spam buttons ala God of War.  While you hit one enemy there are three flanking you from the sides and rear.  It feels like a single player game instead of an MMO because up to level 10 I saw maybe two other players the entire night.  The quests are lame and non inspiring with awful translations of the original "humor," just like every other crappy Korean mass produced MMO.  For a newbie to MMOs it might not be not bad, but anyone that's played an RPG or MMO that wasn't made over 10 years ago on a modern computer will just roll their eyes and uninstall after 15 minutes.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												Dragon Nest is an amazing interactive online action mmo. The combat system is along the lines of Kingdoms of Amalur (with flashier skills) with a 4 player Co-op dungeon system added into it. It also has a branching job advancement system where you choose your path of skill development depending on your preferences. The game started with 4 classes: Warrior, Mage, Archer, and Priest, Since the 2 more classes have been added: Alchemist and Dancer. The Thief/Assassin is currently in Korea and on its way to the US soon. I'm sure more classes will be available for years to come. I suggest you watch this video " 


YouTube™ Video: Dragon Nest Online Update Level 40 Skills 

			Views: 310,255		

			Please Subscribe! http://www.steparu.com/ http://www.youtube.com/Steparu http://www.youtube.com/SteparuTV http://dragonnest.nexon.com/ Upcoming New Content for DN and Skills~		

 " to see the  way skills look in the game. Everyone has their preferences, but I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ACTION RPG FANS LOOKING FOR SOME FUN CO-OP OR SINGLEPLAYER ACTION! IT'S FREE TOO!

												Pretty nifty game for people who are a fan of fast-paced combat but it's action-based kinda of system that not most people are accustomed to but, if you got the patience to learn something new then you would love this game. The sceneries and graphics are pretty awesome and would require a good computer unless you can stand the lags because believe me, the graphics are NOT dated :P The classes are gender-locked unfortunately and there's more female classes with males having so few. 2 new classes were added since last time I played and it's fun! Tinkerer and Kali. Check it out! :)

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												Dragon nest is a pretty damn solid game. Before you say I haven't played it, I've played 200+ hours from their website, not through steam.The combat system is excellent, It's modestly free to play, (the one exception is mounts, it's like 40$ for a chance to get one, but mounts have miniscule use. Trust me.) Dragon nest is an extremely immersive game. The classes are all very fun, and pretty balanced. The only downside is, content updates are rare, being a asian game, we get patches 1/2 YEARS later. Important things to note about dragon nest.The entire game is balanced around PvE, this doesn't mean the PvP is utter♥♥♥♥♥♥ but it's not as good as it could be. Most classes are way stronger in PvP then PvE (namely Kali.). The PvE is 100% instance based. Not once will you find a mob that isn't in an instance. My honest opinion ratings:Combat (overall): 9.5/10PvE: 9/10PvP: 8/10P2W (pay to win 1 being very much so, 10 being not at all): 8/10Graphically: 5/10 (the game really lacks in this. The ♥♥♥♥♥iest of laptops can run this game fine.)Overall: 8/10Bottom line is, this game should not be overlooked. Download this game, and you won't regret it.

												Lets face it we all hate nexons customer service, but they do make some great titles games that grip you. COming from vindictus this game seem like a childs game but in the long run has great pvp system. The controls are very responsive and has great comabt mechanics. The community is very helpful and enjoys running things together. Raids are a challange and you can find yourself face down in the dirt real quick. If you are a fan of any action mmo then you should try out dragon nest. They have introduced the new assassin class which is super bad♥♥♥♥♥ you want crazy dps all I have to say is shinobi.Pros: great community, awesome pve, great mechanics and great anime style graphics, Dont need a top end pc, crazy good pvp including more then one pvp mode, not an over priced store.Cons: Grind fest which can lead to a headache, nexon customer service(have better luck in forums). SInce it is free to play there are outfits which boost stats (they do have free offers to do for currency), so you can consider this slighty pay to win( in pvp) but i have seen people whip♥♥♥♥♥a free to play. Combos have a slight learning curve which can lead to frustration when pvping against a temptest who knwos roation are any class for that matter.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												Dragon Nest is an exciting, action-packed combat game. In the beginning, it starts out slow but as you continue and in the game and start gaining new skills, the term "fast-paced" comes true and you'll be creating long combos and defeating enemies in no time. Although the character customizing is a bit small and not many options, this is great for anybody who wants to play a fun MMORPG without needing to use money to make the experience better.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												This is one, if not, the best of all of the MMORPGS I have every played, and have had the pleasure to experience.  The storyline is amazing, and keeps you wanting to read most of the dialogue the characters have to offer, the many landscapes look beautiful, even with the old-school type graphics this game harbours. And, finally, the gameplay. It is the best aspect of this game so far, and it's what makes this game different from other MMORPGS. You feel like you're actually controlling your character; it isn't the same 'point and click' formula which has, unfortunately, taken control of most other MMORPGs of the era. Above all else, this game manages to be a unique, excellent experience which I am sure that you will all treasure.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2013
												A fun action MMO with a colorful look, a sense of humor, and a lot to keep you coming back for more.  It's geniunely plain entertaining, and pretty easy to get into, letting you enjoy the game without trying to sort out too much arcana or data dumps.  Game progression is also logical, so there's always something new to try out.  Stylistically the cartoony nature keeps it light, though there are elements of odd fanservice, seriousness, and irreverance that don't quite gel and seem odd.  However that's no reason not play what is honestly a good, fun, and rather precise game, wether you want to melt foes with fire, smash them with a sword, or just release a mechanical butler and a legion of roboducks.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												Personal opnion: This game is very good but at some point repetetive. There is some hilarious parts in this and it has potential to be very good. I recommend to play this with friends or you might be bored is a couple minutes unless your used to lonly repetetiveness. after a while this game feels boring so i suggest playing this when your bored. The download time is pretty good for a game with this type of stuff in it. In all i  i belive that this game gets a 7.5/10. its fine if you dont agree with my opinion we all have are opinion.Graphics: Graphics are just fine some times there dull and feel ok-ish but its good graphics. The graphics are fine if you dont mind them personally i dont mind them. At the same time thee graphics are AWESOME it has some detail but compared to other pc games in 2012 its about a fair-ish judgment atleast for my standards.Gameplay: The Gameplay is fairly simple as for a mmo rpg with your types of skills and how you build your character.Theres not to much about leveling up and skills its kinda like all rpg skill stuff. As if it comes to customisations to your character there goes the something about this game i dont like because once you have made your character the only thing that changes about it is you characters weapon and thats it no armor change when you put on different armor this dosent bug me too much. as for the fighting machanics this is very simple to acomplish as all of it is going in worlds fighting by clicking and activating your skills by pressing 1 2 3 and etc. In this game the many levels you play have difficultly and thats your choice on which you choose which is good i like a challenge some times. As for other gameplay aspects i did not cover i think the gameplay could be improved a slight bit.Music: As for music there are some music to comfort you as you roam around fighting in each level and the city. Theres not to much to talk about music as when you play this game your more likely to ignore it as for playing while listenning but still the music was a nice feature so you dont get bored :3. I honestly found the music as for trying to listen to it its ok to take a while to stop and listen and relax....And here is the end of the worst review in the world i bet no one will read this and etc cya.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												Love the game other than the storyline. Pretty much run around towns trying to find Rose, supposedly a girl who has the power of the "Ancients. "Also can lead into a grinding fest if you don't reach the level requirement of a quest, then your only hope is to do plenty of sidequests. Mainly the quest that will have you grind is going to Saint's Haven which requires you to have a level of 25 I believe, I can't remember. The combat system is really fun and doesn't get as repetitive as most games do. But a dissapoint in gender-locked classes. Most classes in this game you would see in any other MMORPG excluding Kali, don't bash me about tinkerer because it's pretty much a ranged shooting class.Downside is the community support, which I'm pretty sure we're not surprised because it was developed by Nexon.Over all, I find this game pretty fun and you can get into quite easily. But I don't encourage you to spend actual money to buy stuff off the website.8.5/10

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												tldr:  Not a bad game.  But not the kind of game I will spend time in.I did nto get far.  At all.  Between the cutesy art and giant boobs, or the rediculously basic tutorial, I can see that the game is not meant for me, a 30+ year old gamer who wants to be challanged and have skilled paly rewarded.What thres me off the game:  Extremely limited range, on "Ranged" characters.  Also, (might be chagable, I did not attempt to fix) the camera aims your spells/attacks.  Meanig you have to look at the badguy you want to hit.  Not a bad thign right?  Except it meant it I was constantly shooting at things feet because I did wanted to keepa  good veiw of the game as well.  But you effectively have to choose between aiming and seeing from a decent angle.You start out weak I get that.  I'm sure the game gets better.  That's the nature of MMO's.  For all I know 5 minutes further down the road it gets less bland,   But the beginning skills for the 4 classes I tried, were rediculously boring and uninspired conpared to the very interesting skill videos showed off at character creation.  And I don't want another "grind through the boring ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t in hopes of to getting to the good stuff" game.  I have enough other games that are fun from the get go to choose from.Not a bad game, but no pull to entice the player past the tutorial that teaches you how to push the spacebar.  But it just gives no reason to play it over other games.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
												Dragon Nest:  Much like the latest Folger's commercial, Dragon Nest doesn't seek to surpass the typical MMO, it looks to land right where every single other one has already innovated, and in most cases, the others have done so in much more engaging and profound ways.  In fact, Dragon Nest doesn't tread any new ground what-so-ever.Prepare for another... Umm... Adventure?  Dragon Nest features a tired storyline that never engages the player, character classes and progressions you've seen for the last decade (or two), an uninspired crafting and upgrade system that's been done to death by every j/k-RPG on the market, and an overpriced cash shop that attempts to lure you in with functions that remove many of the, simply put, intentional annoyances of trying to play the game, such as pitifully limited inventory space and automatic loot pickups.Gameplay is nearly completely combat-based, with drawn-out town segments featuring quest gathering and loot selling.  Combat fails to innovate; expect keyboard gymnastics and mouse-flinging typical of this genre, often interrupted by loading screens every few minutes.  Seriously... The loading screens destroy any immersion to be had here.I would dare to say that the game features some unique artwork and a handful of beautifully modelled monsters and characters, but most of the game centers around scantily-clad female characters (because that's what appeals to the typical gamer, right guys?) which you are introduced to immediately during the game's first loading screen, and 'emo' androgenous males that have left their "provocative" stink on every RPG from the east since Square-Enix.Music and sound effects are nothing worth mentioning; I was mostly annoyed by the droning music clips that are featured and muted it within an hour of my playtime.  Sound effects are cartoonish and repetitive, and their lack of variety becomes painfully apparent during combat.  It should be no surprise that the voice acting featured in the game is top-notch, cream-of the-crop, steaming garbage-on-a-hot-summer-day that always sounds completely out of context; how these voice actors are cast or maintain careers is completely lost on me.The story begins with you being some ho-hum walking randomly through the wilderness, and two little girls are attacked by orcs, one being some oracle that you're desperately trying to save for eons, yet every single time you get close, you feel like you should see "Sorry Mario, but the princess is being held in another castle!"  Oh, and there are evil dragons, apparently.  Most NPC dialogue seems to assume you know what's going on in this world, but the game doesn't ever make an earnest attempt at introducing any of the lore to you so that you know what the hell is going on.Overall, Dragon Nest is a mediocre game; it doesn't innovate in any area, and it's formula is tried and true.  It may be free-to-play, but it makes every possible attempt to make you open your wallet to essentially unbreak itself.  Being a Nexon game, expect their lovely gem 'HackShield' to break and crash your game on a near-hourly basis, often throwing false-positives or simply having some kind of failure that will cause you to lose your progress mid-dungeon.  3 / 10

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												It's an action rpg game with short instances that you can play with friends. Pros: - Different classes to choose from with each two different specializations - Gear and loot - Action combo based gameplay - Graphics are correctCons: - Buggy collision (sometimes you hit right on enemy and there is no effect - Gameplay feels mechanic even though it is more actif than your average rpg game. - Lots of quest about talking to a serie of npcs early in game without any explanation about how the game works, juste about some basic background story for some npcs. (could be a positive aspect for some people, I personally just wanted to play and try the gameplay before getting into the side story) - Not a lot of explanation about how to regroup or join friends that aren't at the same starting point as you. (Comes when you can meet, but you have to play 3-4 instances before you can really join. Simply not a game for me. It was over hyped by the community and compared to Vindictus in term of action. I can affirm there is no ressemblance. It is was more mechanical than its Nexon's related.

												I would probably recommend this game without a second thought 3-4 years ago back when it was 60-70 lvl cap not today though. Before looking at my 33hours on record and thinking i didn't play the game enough i probably have around 2K hours on the SEA server so trust me i played more then enough of this game and i can say without doubt the game is just dead at this point. They bsaically reworked the entire game to where only late game matters after you reach max level and by the time this review is posted max level is 93 so around lvl1 to 93 is just a grind fest and with the game being already pretty much dead most likely its going to be a solo grind then with actual players. Getting partys for raids and such is so hard if your new basically if your new and looking for a mmo game dont bother with this its not new user friendly at all you will feel you are playing a solo game until you reach max level and get good gear. 3 years ago : HELL YEAH PLAY THIS GAME so much fun doing nests ( 4 man really hard dungeouns ) and dragon nests ( 8man raid ) just do main quests / side quests or grind up with party members today : solo grind to 93. find a way to obtain good gear somehow. try to find a party or guild to do raids with ( too much hassle and pain not worth it anymore )

Posted: November 27, 2013
												Dragon nest is the **** it's like playing a single player role playing game with friends.The dungeons are insane and the gameplay  is epic. All the skills are different for each class. Six different classes each with there own subclass The animation may look child like but don't get it wrong the game will blow your mind. Also you don't even need to read the npc text just watching the cutscenes will give you the facts about what going on in the story. There tons of dungeons and pvp arena's. This is one of the best nexon games out there. The download is fast and the controls are easy to use. Theres tons of people to meet. The game is full of 8 people dragon raid dungeons where you can earn uniqe items and equipment. Thier is so much to do in this world even if the animation style is a kiddish approach.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												This game is... okay.I love the art style, honestly the only actual problems are the server-side problems, how the client will crash or something similar.Apparently this bug/error hasn't been fixed so that'll hurt this game's score from me super hardcore big time.I love the character designs and pretty much alot about this game.The glitches and bugs are offputting though, i can't deviate from them.My client crashes every once in awhile, I'm sometimes ejected from the server. my client goes directly to desktop when it crashes. The anti-hack crap doesn't always load and therefore the game then also doesn't load. The game sometimes takes forever to launch, one time taking me over a half hour.Until these bugs are fixed, this game can only earn a 2/10 in overall. Honestly a 9/10 in appearance and a 7/10 in gameplay. The 2/10 has the extra 1 point due to the fact the Kali class dances like a dirty stripper, which i eternally love to the ends of the earth.Without that one thing... this game would be stuck at 1/10 for me.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												Dragon Nest is a typical free-to-play MMORPG that you can play solo or with partying with friends. It doesn't offer anything really special compared to other MMOs and it is extremely casual.The graphics are alright and the music is pretty good, the gameplay is fluid... But, that's far from being the issue i'm having with this game. Pay-to-win usually is, you know, somewhat bad and it makes you stronger than players who don't pay or it takes longer to achieve a certain level of power... But in Dragon Nest it's an entirely new story.I started a new character and I was questing with a friends, Monsters took about 3-4 hits each and using spells usually one or two shotted them, you know, pretty standard... Until we earned NX gear from our "Reward Chest" at around level 9 (you obtain one of those everytime you level up). It was a full set of NX (paid) gear that lasts 7 days. Now, the monsters I was fighting at around this level had about 50 health maybe... And I was hitting around 10-15 damage with my basic attacks.Well, after I equiped the gear, I was hitting around 4000 with my basic attacks and the monsters were just as weak as before! So for the next few levels, I was 1 hitting everything, including bosses with my basic attack... How fun!Also, in your "Reward Chest" you can find "Goddess's Laments". They're used to craft armour, weapons and jewelry... But, they have only implemented armour and weapons for the older classes or something, because if you play a Machina, you can only craft jewelry with those crafting materials and nothing else!Another thing, if you have played this game before and you want to play it on Steam, you can never get the Steam exclusive mount, because you need a fresh account to obtain it.Overall, the game is way too easy, anyone could play it with the paid gear you are given and you get it every few levels it seems. I wouldn't bother playing such a game.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												Dragon nest is an dungeon based RPG and I wasted half of my summer on this game for few reasons.It has Anime-ish style graphics that I always enjoy.There is alot of contents to do especially max level that is very team oriented.Hundreds of quests to complete and a decent storyline.Fast paced game.Fun game to play with friends.PvP is intense (except fighting assassins).All classes has unique skills and combos.Cash shop is aight.Nice animationsCan see Irine's pantsu.But oh boy those cons though.This game is one of the grindest game I have ever witnessed. I've ran the same dungeon 200 times to get from 60-70.The game has very limited character customization in creation and makes you spend your dough to change your appearance.Gender lock classes.The story can get repetitive since it makes you go back to the same dungeon 10 times so people just grinds the same spot to reach a certain level.You get very little exp from dungeon runs so you level very slow unless you are hardcore at this game.PvP lag is very noticeable in every room.High level nest parties are very discriminative in gear and class.Events are pretty much cash shop related.I r8 it 8/8

content:
Posted: October 1, 2016
												My impressions from trying Dragon Nest. Up front I'll say I didn't stay to find out how certain things work because my first impressions made me not care enough to do so, so take everything with a grain of salt. Also, the game's changed hands, so what the new management might do in the near future to change any of this I have no idea.TL;DR: I don't hate the game, but it did annoy me, for a number of reasons detailed below.First off, I couldn't find a way to re-bind default keyboard commands.  ---[Edit Note: Uninstalled, so I can't look, but see Amazia's response in the comments about the game's two separate keybind menus.]---  To move stuff around on the hotbars, or add skills to hotbars, or open a map of the default keybinds, yes. But to do something like re-bind the WASD movement to what I normally use in games (for physical reasons, not just preferential ones), no. I looked at least three times, and it's usually pretty obvious in games and the first thing I do in them. This made combat so aggravatingly awkward for me that I don't know if I can comment with any degree of objectivity. I did still manage to hit things in the starting game, and they fell over and coughed some loot onto the ground with their dying breaths, so there's that.Moving on... Gender-specific classes aren't a dealbreaker, and I knew going in and was prepared to ignore that the male characters look like kids and female characters look like short-skirted cheesecake dollies. Welcome to anime-meets-video games, right? To be fair, when it comes to anime or manga, my preferred style is more in the range of any version of Appleseed, say, than this, but I've enjoyed things done in other styles if they had enough going for them. The wispy-girly voice acting for the female characters was annoying as I watched the intro and tutorial cutscenes, and I ended up hitting Mute and accepting that I would miss stuff that way. Female character emote audio wasn't a lot better. The male character audio was... well, it was what you'd expect from a male protagonist anime character in this style. It didn't irk me like the female voices and didn't stick in my mind enough to have an opinion on it.On the subject of character appearances, though... The initial appearance customization options are extremely limited -- three faces and three sets of eyes, maybe four hairstyles, a handful of hair and eye colors and skin tones, one outfit with a few pieces for which you can separately choose from a small selection of colors. Meh. Based on this limited customization, when I looked it up, I expected that Dragon Nest had to be a lot older than it is. I might have forgiven it if it was, or if its characters were so tiny they're just blobs of color with legs and weapons during play. But this isn't a "tiny blobs of color" game, so it feels like an "option B" game, wherein appearance customization beyond the initial kids' menu of choices will probably involve microtransactions. (Which I'm not automatically against, and purely cosmetic or optional stuff is where I think microtransactions belong. I do think the people keeping a game going deserve to get paid for their work; I've subscribed to or bought stuff in free-to-play games I felt deserved it that had the option to do so. But there's such a thing as going too far to shove people towards the store, and in an MMORPG of this design this falls under "too far".) A brief search suggests I'm right, I saw mention of it taking around $30 to customize an outfit, but again, I didn't stick around to find out. Dragon Nest's initial customization is just too ridiculously limited for an MMORPG of this game's age and "up-close, face to face" design. I mean, it has animated emotes and a command which is specifically labeled as being for flipping the camera around to take a better screenshot of your character... [Edit to FYI: I hit that while standing too close to a zone portal and the game glitched, locking me into snapshot view with no menus and no key command response but not outright frozen. Tabbing out and closing the game program reset it.] To me, Dragon Nest looks like a game that doesn't promote getting attached to an MMORPG character enough to stick around unless you've already spent money on it, but is also built to constantly remind you of the lack of customization you have access to for free. Which feels kind of like asking me to be attached to a paper cutout because it's possible to draw a face on it if I spend money to do so. As noted above, I don't know if the new management plans to change how customization works, or if so, in what ways. I was prepared to let this pass, albeit not happily. Until I ended up with an inventory full of free "gifts" for which I hesitate to use the term...The "free gifts" currently available ingame are part of what made me curious to play it, which is presumably a part of their purpose. But compared to other MMOs in which a gift item is typically an item, you assign the character who gets it and it's theirs, these are more like "real-time-limited free first-time rentals". I opened the mailbox and pending gifts panes and saw realtime expiration timers (meaning: they will expire in that time whether or not I open them, use them, or play the game at all) of about a week to about a month. Timers again on the resulting boxes once accepted, and timers yet again on the items once removed from the boxes... the ones I could even open, that is. One of these boxes required a minimum level 90 to even receive before it would rot, and a couple items from one I could open had a minimum level of 30 to use.I seldom hurry in MMORPGs, I've never attained max level in my first year of playing one. This is down to my playstyle and time spent hanging out with friends or roleplaying with them, as much as to grind factor or time available to play. So the "fastest MMO" splash used to tout this game wasn't a selling point for me, and a row of ticking timers in my character's bagspace wasn't encouragement to go play or invite some friends to play with me, it was encouragement not to. Finding mention that to continue having the items from opened "gifts" after they expired, I'd have to pay some form of item rent, didn't help. I assume if I didn't get to the required level in time any unopenable boxes would evaporate.Again, I don't know if "rent" meant real-money microtransactions or ingame currency, I didn't care enough at that point to find out. I'll tolerate certain kinds of rental in games, too, specifically only AFTER I've had time to learn the game enough to decide if those things are worth investing in. But when I get a gift box as a newbie in a game that I have to level up in a rush in order to open, when I open that box, whatever's inside had better BE a gift: done and dusted, mine from now on. Not a thing with the same timer on it as the box, that's just a disappointment no matter what it is. As a new player I have no real idea whether it's worth investing the time to get and then to rent to keep that stuff. Which I suppose may be part of the point.A required level of level 30 and maybe a month I get in a game that says it's "fast"-- or I would, if the resulting item didn't evidently expire at the same time the giftbox it came from would have, instead of "race to get it, but once I have it it's mine". Maybe it's encouragement to get out there and play and group with people to beat that timer. But rushing to level 90 for something that might then just go away or lock-until-paid anyway? Nope, I don't want aboard this particular hamster wheel.So, after all of that, a row of countdown timers in my character's inventory was what finally made me feel like this game isn't for me. Seems counterproductive for stuff meant to be player bait. I'm sure there's stuff I'm missing about this game, but it just couldn't draw me in long enough for me to want to find out.

												So I came up to this hype of me playing again DN (saw my friend on steam playing it) & since I've gotten so quite busy in the past few months or maybe a year. BUT I SAW ITS ALREADY OWNED BY EYEDENTITY ALREADY??! & I THOUGHT THIS IS OWNED BY NEXON! So I was in shock and immediately look for answers in google, like what is happening! THEN I SAW ITS GONE ALREADY!? ITS NOT NEXON SERVER NO MORE! So I was trying to figure out how do I transfer my old account since that account was made on beta like really fresh dn server lvl 24 cap and no need steam at all! Had 9Chars max lv. 3 chars fully geared on lvl80 Legend +10~+12 and I spend like thousand of hours and money on that account if I will count it prolly 5k or more hrs and for sure under $3k over spend nexon cards. BUT THIS THING BREAKS MY HEART! </3 IT WAS LIMITED TIME ONLY FOR TRANSFERS? IT SAYS THEY EMAIL US, FOR US TO KNOW WHATS GOING ON BUT SERIOUSLY NEXON I DIDNT RECIEVE ANY EMAILS OR NEWS FROM YOU! I know this account has less hrs play on DN cause I never use steam when playing it that was so long ago now I check em out and then this really upset my feelings, this is the one of my very best mmorpg games and now vanish like it was nothing? I dont know if I will play again by any means I will start again like seriously you don't have any idea how I grind that account so much. Guess no DN on me no more since I saw some of nexon FAQ's about the DN Server. Wouldn't recommend on those old players like me that will play again especially if you have same experience with me don't think about it time to move on! and for those new and old player that luckily got their account transfered keep nesting! & HAPPY GAMING! Peace. >,<

												This is an old game, but that doesn't mean it isn't a good one! I would say that anyone who likes MMO should at least try this game. It's very fun, very cute, but also a tad sexual.. But, it's hard to find a game that doesn't have that, so..The play style in this game feels rewarding as I hit enemies, and the music in the game gives me memories of old times when I played it when I was younger. The character customization doesn't give you many options, but that doesn't matter too much to me because the game is still fun, either way. There is also many classes to choose from, and each class has a different weapon you can pick in game, so there is variety.

Play this game for free and love it but i suggest not dumping your money into it unless you can really afford to.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												Oh boy reviewing MMOs, here we go.Pros:- This MMO is really, REALLY fun. I don't know what it is but the gameplay just clicks with me.- Class diversity is alright.- Playing with friends is fun.- Distinct MMO feel but more actiony than most MMOs where you stand in a spot and hit buttons; movement and repositioning are very important aspects of the game.- Grind is MUCH less grindy than most MMOs - quests give a huge chunk of EXP so hitting level cap is fairly easy. - Game rewards skill to a certain degree. I think you can solo all the content in the game if you're good enough. As a solo player this appeals to me.- Lovely aesthetics/visuals.- Runs pretty smooth on my GTX660 (60FPS for the most part except during massive fights/explosions)Cons:- Pay2Win. No way around it, this game is 100% Nexon, which means 100% P2W. Cash items give stats, helpers give stats/autoloot, you can get gambling boxes that can randomly drop stat-giving items, etc. If you don't think this game is P2W you're a moron.- Marketplace is desaturated at lower levels. When I played this game around its release date you could easily find gear for your class/level on the marketplace for reasonable prices, and sell the extra gear you found that you didn't need for around the same amount, but now that the heavy users are all capped out the marketplace is super end-game heavy and super expensive. - Pay2Win. I had to list this twice, this really pisses me off. The game could've been 20000x better without the P2W aspects.- Daily softcaps on dungeons. You get 700 PWR per day and 500 bonus per week, and dungeons cost PWR (I think 12-30 or something). PWR gives you bonus EXP while in dungeons, which means that if you spend your 1200 PWR in a day you don't get bonus EXP and you get gimped. I know at some point before this used to be a hard cap (ie you couldn't enter dungeons at ALL if you had 0 PWR) but I think you can dungeon without PWR now (not 100% sure). This is a minor gripe as it only really affects people playing 6+ hours a day (which I sometimes do).Overall:I do recommend the game if you like the gameplay and visual styles. There's PvP and PvE in the game (both very prominent end-game) and, being quest-based grind, it doesn't feel as grindy as some other MMORPGs. Pay2Win sucks but Nexon is going to be Nexon so unless someone else takes over DN and removes the P2W aspects it's probably just going to get worse (look at Maplestory).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												LONG REVIEW INCOMING~I have played this game for over a year now(close to 2 years). I started out off of steam and then downloaded it through Steam.I have multiple characters, 3 max leveled and the rest still working on. I focus primarily on PVP but I also have experience with the nests & Dragon Raids (PVE).I have never once felt the need to purchase items through the Dragon Vault to play the game:>You do not NEED costumes as they are null and void in PVP, and the effect they have on your stats are so minimal that you do not notice a difference in Nests or Raids. (I purchased 2 because I liked how they looked on my character)>You do not NEED a dual skill scroll, I survived with out one (A hybrid build) all the way till recently when I got a free dual skill scroll from an event.>You do not NEED any extra talisman slots, crest slots, etc. (I can do everything max lvl w/o these)>You do not NEED a pet (you get one for free through achievements anyway)>You do not NEED a fancy mount (you get one for free through the main quest)With all that said let's realize something. Nexon gives the players multiple Dragon Vault objects for free as you level up and through seasonal events.>You receive free skill reset scrolls at 15 through Irene, and when you approach each "previous level cap" level (40,50,60,70,80) your gift box gives you a free reset scroll. Each of these items are worth $15 or 15k NX yet you receive multiple ones just in case you're new and mess up.>You receive a free mount through the main quest Brownie Joker or Mocha Sugar, yes they are not the must extravagant mounts (They're just horses) they still do the job of allowing the player a quicker way to move. You can also farm for more fancier horses through the higher level nests for free.>Any time there is a technical problem you will most likely receive compensation for the server troubles or problems. Most of the time it involves Dragon Eggs (a small amount but RNG can be merciful). Also Dragon Eggs of any type are just RNG models. Your chances of getting rare items is static. Spending more money will not increase your chances.>Through seasonal events I have received free resets, free dual skill scroll, free costume parts, free pets and more.GAMEPLAY:The Gameplay is fast and entertaining. You must learn how to dodge and be aware of your surroundings for higher level bosses, Raids and Nests. You should know how your moves work (Super Armor & Super Armor Break). It is instance based not open world and therefore the dungeons can be repetitive. The main story I find to be very enjoyable and entertaining.PVP can be difficult due to certain unbalances between classes and frustrating just like every games PVP. PVP is normally equalized or partially equalized so you do not need top gear or any gear to pvp (Unless you are doing Ladder pvp which is more rank based)My advice would be to take the game slow. Try to do the nests at each level avaliable. Level with friends or join a guild it's more fun with a group. Don't specialize in one aspect. Be able to do both PVP and PVE.Hopefully this helps,apologize for the long review ~Have fun gaming!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												While Dragon Nest can be a little repetitive and may require power leveling with another higher-level friend to avoid grinding for days, the game contains a surprisingly entertaining cast of characters and plenty of side quests, if you're playing for plot. One of the more enjoyable, entry-level MMORPGs to get into if you're new to the genre.The battle system is simple enough, and all of the classes I've played so far debut with a storyline of their own, which is a plus. It's easy to get hooked, but it's also easy to forget about or drop the game if the XP/leveling curve takes up too much time that you might not have to spend. Overall? Dragon Nest is a cute, fun way to burn a couple hours. It might not be as pretty as Wakfu or Warframe, but you're guaranteed a fairly well-written plot with a battle system that's hard to fault.

												A very  cute free to play Nexon MMO, this game doesn't do much in the way of revolutionary graphics or gameplay, but the story is fantastic and it's a thoroughly enjoyable MMO with friends. Solo gameplay is possible, however dungeons can get repetitive if you don't follow the story or have company and friends to play along with, or simply just chat to as you work your way through the game.Cash shop is not pay to win, though many items have a time limit. You can pay more to gain permanent costumes though, and pets require an item to stay alive every 7 days-30 days, which can be purchased in-game or in the cash shop.If you enjoy free to play rpgs with a solid story and adorable art work, check it out. The community is friendly and the story is great- and considering it's free, there's not much to lose!

The specializations have similiar ideals, but like for Archer as an example, one goes melee, the other is ranged. Quite fascinating. The only problem and the only thorn in my side for this game would be the annoying process of griniding to a higher level JUST to do the story. So if I were to rate it, I wouild give it 4 out of 5 stars.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2015
												I played this game when it was released around 2011 and decided to pick it up again once I saw that it was on Steam. The combat is very heavy feeling and satisfying, making that Korean MMO-style grind not so unbearable (I play a Paladin and using the skill "Sacred Hammering" is fun as hell). Another thing I like, strangely enough, is the quest dialog and characters. the writing is funny, charming, and a pleasure to read. A unique feature is the option to give gifts to NPC's you want to be friends with,  occasionally giving you gifts back and faction points to spend in a shop for items (No one take May, she's mine). A downside is that the "Free to Play" system is a little limiting compared to more recent additions in the F2P genre, with things like inventory space being completely locked unless you pay real cash, although figuring out what certain items do allowed me to downsize and I've had considerably less problems with it since.I recommend giving it a try if you picked up that nasty MMO habit again.

												Pros (Top 5):-Fantastic combat system that involves actual skill-Great Game mechanics (Especially Quests)-Smooth gameplay for its graphics-Class system is well balanced and large-Class skills are interesting and fun to useCons:-VERY LOW new player base. most new characters are secondary character to high level players-After level 26 it gameplay begins to decline due to lack of lower level player community-Not fun unless you have friends (in my opinion)-Instanced based surroundings aren't very immersive. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												Love the game but it does have some areas that people may not like.•The game can be boring alone and I recomend playing with friends.•There are times that you are tempted to spend real money (as with all free 2 plays).•You need a reasonably good computer (I could not play the game for awhile due to my computer, then again it was a little crappy)•The classes are gender locked (and most classes are girls, there are only four guy classes)Even with these this game is still amazing, the reasons for this include... •A huge skill tree (although not as big as some games)•Great story line•Characters look amazing•The classes branch into specializations•The skills (special attacks) look amazing (especially after getting a specialization)•Costume items give you a cool look until your armor actually looks good (costume items that are given by the game for free will dissapear after a week)•It is easy to switch between servers in game and it is very enjoyable when playing with other people. •Multiple characters can be created on one account (up to 20!)I am currantly at level 52 so this may change as you (or anyone else) progress further in the game, but the game is fun and enjoyable so I would recommend it to anyone with a little free time.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
												To be honest, the game is pretty good. I still play it even though I force myself to stop playing it. Only because none of my mates likes the 'Japanese Anime, Cartoony graphics'. But Ive played a few MMORPGs and this is one stands out in when it comes to the quest and dungeoning game play.  Here's a list of pros and cons in my point of viewPro's- Fast paced gameplay (skills and graphics *thumbs up*)- Pretty good for a Free to Play game- The monsters and their abilities are pretty cool- When I reached lvl 25+ The game actually gets harder. (its not just about left clicking anymore, timing the right skills is crucial)- Choices between Easy/Normal/Master/Abbys when it comes to dungeons is handy- Good set of classes. (I played as swordsman and tinker)Con's- Everything's seems like a dungeon base PVE which is something I didnt really like. (Im just a big fan of open world)- I feel like its one of those PTW games. (when it comes to armour upgrading... when I hit lvl 32+ I feel like I need the best armour I can)- Its hard to meet people around your level (when I reached lvl 25+) so it gets a bit of grindy- Its hard to make money to get awesome items. In conclusion, I think its a game worth trying. But its alot better played with friends (then again that goes without saying with every other game). I still give it a thumbs up!!
