content:
Posted: October 14, 2016
												Dragon Nest does one thing, and it does it well: fast-paced action combat. The skills that you use in battle are visually spectacular, there are tons of cool combos you can pull off, and the dozens of playable classes ensure that you will not get bored quickly. If you can look past the outdated graphics and having to run the same dungeons multiple times, you will have a great time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 15, 2016
												Honestly i've played alot of this game and there is a few things I must list off.1. Insanely good graphics- This is a good thing for me and alot of other users/players out there with bad computers.Even though my computer is bad I can run this on its highest graphics which is a good thing for me.2. Fast Paced Combat- Alot of you know what that is but unlike other mmorpgs this is a hard thing to do but fun.It makes you analyze your opponents and choose what skills you use, but thats not this same for all classes some class you can just get in there kill and walk out ( of course looting the dead npcs enemys first ).3. Friendly community- This is said to be in alot of mmorpgs but thanks to the mods and admins everyone here is nice, funny, and you can always find someone to help you with a harder dungeon. Which leads me to my next one.4. Dungeons- The dungeons may get a little repetitive but thats just with the design and even thats not guaranteed. With each new level there's different groups of enemys, places, chests, bosses. The only way I found so far to get the same exact level is to play the same one again.5. Fun Story Line- This may not seem like a big one but it is, without a fun story line the game's just not worth playing.This game has a interesting story line to say the least, not only that, but it keeps you on you feet. Even when I got bored and left the game to do something else, I always kept coming back to see what happens next.6. Completely Free- This game is completely free which is hard to say since I gave it good reviews and it's free, but it's true. You can do everything in the story line even the expansions. This is the one exception, and that's the market place which is to be expected in any MMO/RPG or combination of the two.So all in all this is a really great game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												Used to play when the game was just getting started. I lost my steam account then due to my laptop breaking. So i decided to take a 2 year break from it. And now I'm back! They've added the assassin and then eventually added Lencea. But this game has it's pros and cons. Pros: 1. Features different storylines for the different characters.2. Fighting style and combat is just overwhelming. Different specialties and subclasses can be chosen.3. It's original. I haven't seen any other games like this and is possibly the closest thing to SAO I have seen.Cons: 1. Though the storyline is great, some main quests require you to be a certain level. And after getting to lvl. 40, leveling up is gonna take some time unless you're in a level 30 guild or have the 200% exp scroll.2. Server problems. Sometimes the game will log you out. "Disconnected from world" This might happen but it's not a big deal. 3. It takes a little while to adjust to the game. All the different letters open up different things. But once you're in the game click the letter "H" this open up a guide that tells you what each key is used for. Also there are so many skills, it would take up the whole number pad and it'll be a bit frustrating moving your fingers from ASWD to the number 0 or 9.Overall this game is great. 10/10 I recommend it to anyone whoo is into Adventures, Actions, Storylines, and MMORPG. Though the graphics may be a bit cartoonish, it is a great game.

												I have put a lot of time into this game, I used to play it back when level 50 was cap.  I loved the heck out of this game.  The graphics and the atmosphere as well as the music and voice overs.  The only huge issue I have with it is the marketplace purchases.  I pay $10 for a pet that picks up items for me because lets face it pressing F 100x per a dungeon just gets old after a while.  So with this $10 pet after i purchased it only lasts for 30 days.....  So dumping money into this game is a waste.  Everything on the market expires after a certain time limit.  Nexon is famouse for it.  Play this game for free and love it but i suggest not dumping your money into it unless you can really afford to.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
												Dragon Nest is a gem among MMORPGs. The game sports an incredibly satisfying combat system that never gets dull whilst you slice and dice through thousands of mobs. I haven't played all of the classes yet, but the ones I have played are all equally entertaining and flashy. Hit up your weeb friends and play it with them because if you play alone you'll probably get sick and tired of grinding dungeons solo. Either that or make some new friends with the... colorful players that also play on their lonesome. Guilds are also a thing, join my guild. Apply to the Poot Empire! POOT POOT!The story had me captivated at first but quickly became too convoluded to be worth reading through so I just skip all that nonsense. I think it's for the best.♥PROS♥Da' graphicsDa' combat systemDa' different worldsDa' meaningful bonds you can create with your favorite questgiving NPCsDa' dancing emotes. 10/10 dances.Da' corny anime♥♥♥♥♥writing and style...cons..Can get dull if you're not playing with a friendCan get weird if you talk to people who want to be your friendCan't name your guild the 'D Club' because it "contains a forbidden word"The stories are convoluded and all over the placeThe corny anime♥♥♥♥♥writing and styleLove this game and I always will

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												Dragon Nest incorporates non-targeting system gameplay to create a fast paced action filled experience. Players choose from a range of hero classes, characters that are of the Dragon Nest storyline that can equip customizable gear and weapons. Characters exist in one world, Kalahan, which resulted from Nexon uniting all four worlds to unite the characters. Devastating skills can also be learned, to increase one's power when defeating monsters in instanced dungeons or defeating other players in PVP.Dragon Nest also has the advantage of being nearly completely skill-based, with lower level characters being able to defeat high level characters in PVP with skill alone. This allows a more experienced player that is of a lower level to dominate a less experienced player of a higher level player in PVP. I highly recommend Dragon Nest to all you hardcore players!

												As someone who's played DN for well over 5 years, I was both sorely disappointed and infuriated with the company 'switch.' I'd spent a good deal of money on Dragon Vault items, leveled over 10 characters, and spent a combined ttal of over 800 hours (including before DN was on Steam) in game. Then, Nexon just decided to DROP the game. No warning through emails, no kiss my♥♥♥♥♥ no nothing. Just account deleted when I went to log on. I lost everything. I am too furious at the horrible customer service and the way they just decided to pretty much screw over all their old players. How hard is it to port accounts? Seriously. I played FFXIV and they kept all my data over the years despite not playing for years on end.Honestly, can't recommend this game to anyone anymore. Go play Guild Wars, WoW or Final Fantasy XIV if you want a good fantasy MMO game. And a company that won't delete all your data because they're too lazy to port.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
Product received for free
												Dragons Nest is an MMORPG with a wide range of class each of which curtails off into seperate specializations. With anime style graphics you won't be getting anything like PoE or Diablo 3, but they are endearing in its own little way. I enjoyed the game but many parts of it especially if you are a new player can feel like a grind fest for lack of knowledge about better or faster ways to level. Party play is encouraged in many respects but do not expect to make many new friends in game. You can join which have levels of their own and some of which are well run and regulated. The gameplay is fun but can get repetitive. Level cap days a good amount of time to reach especially your first time. Events on holidays are also fun.

Posted: June 11, 2016
												Pros:- I really like the fluid combat system; its much more preferred to the lock-on system I'm used to.- Cute, simple art style.- Low poly graphics make it playable on low-end laptops like my own, which is pretty sweet. - Really fun to try out different combat plastyles of different classes.- Pretty friendly in-game community.- Can get pretty decently geared through casual, f2p gameplay alone.- Really fast levelling, so you can get to end game content quickly.Cons:- Levelling may be a little TOO easy. Things only start to get challenging in end-game content.- I personally like to solo content, but Dragon Nest encourages being in a party/guild. If you insist on solo-ing, things start to feel more like a boring grind-fest.- You eventually reach a point where the only way to get stronger is with paid cosmetic items. It takes a while to get to that point, though. And their stats don't make a huge difference, but you do still end up with p2p players being more geared than f2p players.Overall, fun little game to jump into.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 9, 2013
												It is fun at first when you solo, but being an MMO it soon loses it's fun late game as it pressures you too look for parties with similar interests. However this game is very fun with friends.  Playing with friends presents higher rewards as well. You can play the game alone and you likely won't get anything out of it but playing with a full party you're liable to have lots of fun and get lots of good loot. Characters that you can choose from are stock so don't expect to pick a class and then changing the gender.  You wanna be a girl you have the choices between the Archer, Kali, Sorceress, and Tinker. You wann play a guy ? Then Warrior and Cleric are for you. If the idea of stock characters doesn't bother you but rather the game play does? Each of the characters are different and each have different styles of play. This game literally has everything. You like shooting? Then play an Archer or sorceress. Granted the sorceress has more AOE type skills. Ya wanna beat enemies to a pulp up close and personal than be a warrior, cleric, or a kali ( dancer) if you wanna cast aoe while you do so.  Hell try the tinker too its gots shooting, aoe, and even a giant robot named Alfredo!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
My Thoughts/About The Game Let me be clear. I have logged over 1,000 hours into game. I was a member of the game way back. I figured I should get DragonNest through steam, because it has been awhile.Honestly, I got bored of the game. Overall, I left the community, but I decided to come back to see what had changed. Here is what I think about the game.Pros:+ Combat is unqiue+ Multiple classes+ Nests (They are like big boss dungeons)+ New updates happen often+ Pets+ Farming+ Marketplace for trading+ Do sexy dances+ Can play as a loli+ Mercenaries (Helpful allies)+ Cash shop+ Fast travel in towns+ Mounts+ Free to playCons:- Broken balancing between classes- Most classes have stories that are repetitive- Pvp needs to be fixed- There should be a way to communicate with people in-game other than using chat- Can't use mounts outside of towns- Community is a bit toxic In Conclusion  This is a great MMORPG. The game truly earns the title, the world's fastest action MMORPG. I still love the game, and you should totally try it out. It's super easy to lvl up in this game because it's so ridiculously easy. I don't understand why they removed higher difficulties in some dungeons. I believe you don't need to buy stuff from the cash shop to stand out, but whateverl. In conclusion,  I recommend  this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												Talking from 80 patch through 90 patch, some things have changed and somethings have stayed. Sadly though, this game is less about the 89 levels you will achieve now and more about that level 90 since nothing matters untill that point. The game has been like this a little bit but never so hard untill 90 patch.  So for now, I'm going to give a pro and con list on what I think is good about this game and what is not.  I'll also be talking about common problems people say they have with this game and why its true and not true.Pro:Good combat, by far it is one of the most fluent and cool looking combat I have ever seen.Most of the skills you obtain from your class are cool looking.Leveling up is not so bad.There are so many nice people that will help you, dont get me wrong there are jerks in this game but people see these people more often because they join parties instantly without any idea of what to do about mechs and what gear to have to do the nest so they get kicked. IF you do not want to be kicked, just create the party and say "Carry pls" or "Practice" since if you join a 90 nest party and people see you do not have the proper gear to contribute, they will kick since they dont want to risks.The guilds, I feel like people who make guilds in this game are really good at it, the really high level guilds somehow manage to keep the right ranks of each person, make sure everyone gets the help they need, and also make everyone happy and have a fun time with each other.  Smaller guilds are the same thing but more often there are worse guilds; dont get me wrong there are many good small guilds just that some of them are small because they are bad.Nests and raid 80-90 patch.  I was never really fond of the "Do this little mini-game to get pass this area" type of thing.  The Dragon Nest dev's are deffinitely not good at those things but each boss they make have really good mechanics and fun play against.The possibility of being able to solo.  Now this topic is really hard to discuss since most of you are probably already saying "If you never get hit in a nest you can solo anything." Or "If you have the proper gear it doesnt matter being able to solo level 90 regular nest, you just do too much damage." what I come in turn of being able to solo is that no matter what gear you have as long as you have level 90 gear that is enhanced even by a little, you are being able to solo a dungeon while being able to take a few hits.  Humans make mistakes, they will get hit, not everyone can do a no hit run.  Just the proper weapon/armor (not even gems/crests) and you can solo the level 90 nests right now but will take a long time.Now onto the cons, no game is perfect just keep that in mind; I do not want people saying that this game is better than this game for this reason, its just a big mess of crap.  Just see what you like about mmo's and what you hate about them, if any of them are in the list make a chart with those pro and cons, if pro or con outweighs, you choose from there.Cons:Jelly's, by how much I will say this game is deffinitely not pay to win, this one part is most likely the most pay to win part.  Jelly's make it so any gear that you want to enhanced that is 6+ wont break, problem with this? You can only pay to gain these or events. No other way.  People also sell these in mp for around 550g-600g for 50 of them, btw it cost 11 to upgrade just epic gear per try.Lag: Somethings this game lags quite a bit depending on the map; the new nightmare dungeon for me lags more than the main raid with everyone throwing out their abilities with 8 people in raid party vs soloing the nightmare dungeon. I think this is due to the fact with just so many air particles in that dungeon.  What I would like is that if Nexon would turn off air particles so that it makes computer lag less UNLESS if its to fit a important raid like the Desert Dragon.Obtaining gear: Sometimes obtaining gear is easy, other times it is deffinitely not.  Gear, accessories, dragon gems, and crests can be expensive for newer players.  Some of the best gear (like Nightmare weapons) are also impossible to buy so you have to earn them.  I personally dont see that as a problem but for some of you out there it is.Mechanics: I know, I said the mechanics on bosses in this game are really good; problem is at first its annoying.  There are party wipe mechanics that are annoying and sometimes hard to time if you did not practice it about 5-6 times. Kind of annoying but not a big problem. No more practice nests/raids: There used to be a option called "Practice" on nests/raids, this makes it so that you dont lose any durability and or clears while doing that certain dungeon.  It was made to practice it obiovously.  I have no idea why they took this out and I think they should have just implemented this on 90 dungeons.Levels 1-89 dont matter: Any gear you obtain from level 1-89 wont matter once you reach level 90; no matter how enhanced they are.  It does not matter if their 10+ or even 11+ enhancement they will be useless even if they were level 87. Why? The new dragon gems are super valuable and its out leveled by level 90 gear. Which the gems can be equiped with level 90 epics (blue).Removed nests/raids/difficulties: I remember when level 16 nest had the abyss difficulty on it, was removed far back since people would spam those dungeons; waste no pwr; and gain hundreds of gold by the gold rabbit with little to no effort.  Now, level 60-70 dungeons dont have abyss difficulty and I find that stupid since its so much harder to level up even though this game its not hard to level up in.  Also the removal of more than HALF of hte nests and raids really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off.  They should have just kept the raids/nests if they are reworking them, or even better make new level 90 nests but I guess 1 new level 90 nest is enough like 1 level 80 nest.Discussion: Now many people I have seen on this review area say this game is PAY TO WIN.  What makes a game pay to win is when you will not reach end game if you do not pay for certain items, when you cant achieve gold without paying, or when you cant even do anything due to the fact of other reasons.  This game is not pay to win because achieving gold is not difficult in this game if your not lazy; do not blame the game if you are lazy that is just you.  Selling nx things like jelly beans is a fast way to obtain gold but reallity, its not worth it unless your a millionair.  Most rich people in dragon nest dont even spend a dime on the game unless they want a costume for one of hteir characters, not to make gold.Overall: It is a great game for those who want to be in end game content and are willing to spend a lot of time to get there. If you are not dedicated to do so and or are lazy just look away from this game because you will give up when you reach level 90 and get kicked for not thinking or watching video's at least of the mechanics. If dedicated, 9/10, a game worth your dedication and hard work but will have a few issue's for you but will be worth it.; if you are lazy and not dedicated, 7/10, a game with a couple of flaws and should be played time to time, not worth playing a lot.This is the first review I done so I hope this helps you on choosing to download this game or not; if you just read this bottom paragraph or just skimmed through the list please reread it because if you do decide to download this game and dont like it, you will waste hours while if you had read this you would have only wasted minutes.  The average rating of this game is 8/10 combining the 2 scores above.  I hope you guys have fun time nesting.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 16, 2015
												I played this game when it was released around 2011 and decided to pick it up again once I saw that it was on Steam. The combat is very heavy feeling and satisfying, making that Korean MMO-style grind not so unbearable (I play a Paladin and using the skill "Sacred Hammering" is fun as hell). Another thing I like, strangely enough, is the quest dialog and characters. the writing is funny, charming, and a pleasure to read. A unique feature is the option to give gifts to NPC's you want to be friends with,  occasionally giving you gifts back and faction points to spend in a shop for items (No one take May, she's mine). A downside is that the "Free to Play" system is a little limiting compared to more recent additions in the F2P genre, with things like inventory space being completely locked unless you pay real cash, although figuring out what certain items do allowed me to downsize and I've had considerably less problems with it since.I recommend giving it a try if you picked up that nasty MMO habit again.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												Love the game but it does have some areas that people may not like.•The game can be boring alone and I recomend playing with friends.•There are times that you are tempted to spend real money (as with all free 2 plays).•You need a reasonably good computer (I could not play the game for awhile due to my computer, then again it was a little crappy)•The classes are gender locked (and most classes are girls, there are only four guy classes)Even with these this game is still amazing, the reasons for this include... •A huge skill tree (although not as big as some games)•Great story line•Characters look amazing•The classes branch into specializations•The skills (special attacks) look amazing (especially after getting a specialization)•Costume items give you a cool look until your armor actually looks good (costume items that are given by the game for free will dissapear after a week)•It is easy to switch between servers in game and it is very enjoyable when playing with other people. •Multiple characters can be created on one account (up to 20!)I am currantly at level 52 so this may change as you (or anyone else) progress further in the game, but the game is fun and enjoyable so I would recommend it to anyone with a little free time.

												I love this game, been playing it for many years, since beta actually. It started much slower and grindier, now it's come to a point where the grind isn't to to bad. it is however still an action rpg that is instance based, so it is very very repetitive. Gear is the same way you have to grind the same maps for a chance at specific pieces to drop. But no worse than RO, lineage 2, or any other J-rpg i've ever played. if you like J-rpg's you'll like this one. even the story is pretty good if you decide to read it as you're going through. Combat is pretty good but ping will make you hate yourself and others in team pvp, combo's are super satisfying to chain together, abilitys have the right amount of spectical with flashes and pretty light effects to keep you interested. Class growth is pretty satisfying aswell. you have a 1st 2nd and 3rd class to advance through, each class has two branches of specialization spare nightmare classes. and yeah its good♥♥♥♥♥♥

IF you do not want to be kicked, just create the party and say "Carry pls" or "Practice" since if you join a 90 nest party and people see you do not have the proper gear to contribute, they will kick since they dont want to risks.The guilds, I feel like people who make guilds in this game are really good at it, the really high level guilds somehow manage to keep the right ranks of each person, make sure everyone gets the help they need, and also make everyone happy and have a fun time with each other.  Smaller guilds are the same thing but more often there are worse guilds; dont get me wrong there are many good small guilds just that some of them are small because they are bad.Nests and raid 80-90 patch.  I was never really fond of the "Do this little mini-game to get pass this area" type of thing.  The Dragon Nest dev's are deffinitely not good at those things but each boss they make have really good mechanics and fun play against.The possibility of being able to solo.  Now this topic is really hard to discuss since most of you are probably already saying "If you never get hit in a nest you can solo anything." Or "If you have the proper gear it doesnt matter being able to solo level 90 regular nest, you just do too much damage." what I come in turn of being able to solo is that no matter what gear you have as long as you have level 90 gear that is enhanced even by a little, you are being able to solo a dungeon while being able to take a few hits.  Humans make mistakes, they will get hit, not everyone can do a no hit run.  Just the proper weapon/armor (not even gems/crests) and you can solo the level 90 nests right now but will take a long time.Now onto the cons, no game is perfect just keep that in mind; I do not want people saying that this game is better than this game for this reason, its just a big mess of crap.  Just see what you like about mmo's and what you hate about them, if any of them are in the list make a chart with those pro and cons, if pro or con outweighs, you choose from there.Cons:Jelly's, by how much I will say this game is deffinitely not pay to win, this one part is most likely the most pay to win part.  Jelly's make it so any gear that you want to enhanced that is 6+ wont break, problem with this? You can only pay to gain these or events. No other way.  People also sell these in mp for around 550g-600g for 50 of them, btw it cost 11 to upgrade just epic gear per try.Lag: Somethings this game lags quite a bit depending on the map; the new nightmare dungeon for me lags more than the main raid with everyone throwing out their abilities with 8 people in raid party vs soloing the nightmare dungeon. I think this is due to the fact with just so many air particles in that dungeon.  What I would like is that if Nexon would turn off air particles so that it makes computer lag less UNLESS if its to fit a important raid like the Desert Dragon.Obtaining gear: Sometimes obtaining gear is easy, other times it is deffinitely not.  Gear, accessories, dragon gems, and crests can be expensive for newer players.  Some of the best gear (like Nightmare weapons) are also impossible to buy so you have to earn them.  I personally dont see that as a problem but for some of you out there it is.Mechanics: I know, I said the mechanics on bosses in this game are really good; problem is at first its annoying.  There are party wipe mechanics that are annoying and sometimes hard to time if you did not practice it about 5-6 times. Kind of annoying but not a big problem. No more practice nests/raids: There used to be a option called "Practice" on nests/raids, this makes it so that you dont lose any durability and or clears while doing that certain dungeon.  It was made to practice it obiovously.  I have no idea why they took this out and I think they should have just implemented this on 90 dungeons.Levels 1-89 dont matter: Any gear you obtain from level 1-89 wont matter once you reach level 90; no matter how enhanced they are.  It does not matter if their 10+ or even 11+ enhancement they will be useless even if they were level 87. Why? The new dragon gems are super valuable and its out leveled by level 90 gear. Which the gems can be equiped with level 90 epics (blue).Removed nests/raids/difficulties: I remember when level 16 nest had the abyss difficulty on it, was removed far back since people would spam those dungeons; waste no pwr; and gain hundreds of gold by the gold rabbit with little to no effort.  Now, level 60-70 dungeons dont have abyss difficulty and I find that stupid since its so much harder to level up even though this game its not hard to level up in.  Also the removal of more than HALF of hte nests and raids really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off.  They should have just kept the raids/nests if they are reworking them, or even better make new level 90 nests but I guess 1 new level 90 nest is enough like 1 level 80 nest.Discussion: Now many people I have seen on this review area say this game is PAY TO WIN.  What makes a game pay to win is when you will not reach end game if you do not pay for certain items, when you cant achieve gold without paying, or when you cant even do anything due to the fact of other reasons.  This game is not pay to win because achieving gold is not difficult in this game if your not lazy; do not blame the game if you are lazy that is just you.  Selling nx things like jelly beans is a fast way to obtain gold but reallity, its not worth it unless your a millionair.  Most rich people in dragon nest dont even spend a dime on the game unless they want a costume for one of hteir characters, not to make gold.Overall: It is a great game for those who want to be in end game content and are willing to spend a lot of time to get there. If you are not dedicated to do so and or are lazy just look away from this game because you will give up when you reach level 90 and get kicked for not thinking or watching video's at least of the mechanics. If dedicated, 9/10, a game worth your dedication and hard work but will have a few issue's for you but will be worth it.; if you are lazy and not dedicated, 7/10, a game with a couple of flaws and should be played time to time, not worth playing a lot.This is the first review I done so I hope this helps you on choosing to download this game or not; if you just read this bottom paragraph or just skimmed through the list please reread it because if you do decide to download this game and dont like it, you will waste hours while if you had read this you would have only wasted minutes.  The average rating of this game is 8/10 combining the 2 scores above.  I hope you guys have fun time nesting.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
												Honestly, I loved this game with a passion. Splendid soundtrack, wasn't TOO much of a pay-to-win game, it was well made, the combat system was AMAZING, there were several classes with some really neat specilizations you could choose from when getting to a certain level, on top of that, levelling up your character wasn't too particularly hard. The game was just... excellent.That is, until the update came. The update that removed some very important things. Such as quests on the message boards, stages that had high rewards, which, without those it's significantly more difficult to actually make a decent profit off of level completion, sometimes even after one you could potentially lose cash from repairing your gear. Sure it added the level 90 cap, and the players were waiting for that for months on end, but were soon to realize it was more of a disappointment than something nice.However, they are still updating the game and not abandoning it, which is awesome, and when they add new classes, I am sure to hop on and check them out. The Dragon Nest team has created something incredible, and I really wish for it to only get better, but honestly with that update, I'm not so sure it will happen.I really do recommend this to people who are looking for a quick time-killing game, but I would not suggest becoming a hardcore fan that wastes all their time playing this one game in particular. You'll just end up disappointed, like I was.In the end, I still like Dragon Nest, I do play occasionally, and it is definitely one of my all times RPG's, but it's just not... that great anymore.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												EDIT 8/15/2016:As of the date above, I am changing my review of this game from positive to negative. The game is falling apart.I don't know what the developers are doing, but alot of the game's content has been removed. Specifically the "Nests" - Special dungeons that used to be run in party's to get decent gear and drops for your level bracket.They have removed nearly all the nests except the ones for very high levels (dont quote me on this) but I believe any Nests under level 70 or 80 have been removed entirely.Also, board quests have been completely removed from the game (bonus quests that you could pick up to turn in for xp. Posted on small boards before dungeon entrances). Those board quests made grinding an option, as many were repeatable for xp. They also gave people the option to not have to run through any quests but the main story quest line. Now you are actually forced to go through numerous npc side quests for reasonable xp. This is a very frustrating point for people who have more than one character and dont wanna have to re-read the entire storys content/ menial side content.I've noticed large portions of the game's dialogue is now showing up in korean. I know this is a korean developed game, but everything in this version was originally properly translated and coded into english. It's very frustrating now to click on things like NPC's or boards only for it to come up completely in Korean and you have 0 idea whatis being said.*THIS GAME NO LONGER HAS A DIFFICULTY LEVEL. THERE IS NO DIFFICULTY!Yes folks, you read that right. After taking hiatus from this game, returning, and making a new character on the newely released silver hunter class- I was legitimately shocked, and disgusted at how easy the dungeons were.I was able to basically 2 hit everything in the dungeons. BUT IT GETS BETTER!As you level, nexon gives you this free special level up chest you can open which often has 5 to 7 day costumes and acessories you can equip to make your character look nice. But guess what? Those sets give stat benefits. Literally be amazed as you equip your costume and go from 2 shotting, to 1 shotting literally everything in the dungeons- INCLUDING the boss of each dungeon. I kid you not, 1 skill was all it took me to defeat bosses, and it gave me 0 satisfaction.I brought a friend who was new to the game to try to play with me, and even he complained about the game being too easy. He said he didn't feel like he really was doing anything.Even hard mode still poses 0 challenge, even if you have sh*t common gears and weaponry.I also heard the highest difficulty setting for the dungeons ABYSS mode (which also dished out the best xp and rewards for completion), was removed completely for all the low to mid level dungeons and are only reserved for very high level dungeons (again i believe somewhere above lvl 70 to 80 but don't quote me). I can only confirm that there was no abyss mode for the lower level dungeons anymore, as I was too disgusted with the state of the game to bother logging on the my higher level alt to check the other dungeons.But as usual, the character models, attacks, specializations, and effects are still pretty awsome.HOWEVER.This game is far from the fantasy MMO it was when i first picked it up. If anything it is more of a hack n slash PVP game. Literally PVP is the only redeeming thing left in this game, and to PVP decently you have to level.All of the basic fundamentals of what used to make this game great for some reason have been made exclusive to high levels or people nearing the level cap, leaving little rewarding content for the rest of the majority of the game. This has caused many people to abandon the game all together, and i've definitely noticed a decrease in the number of players.In it's current state I would absolutely not reccomend this game.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2016
												Dragons Nest is an beat-em up MMORPG heavily focused with instances. It is NOT open-world. Played until level 21 with warrior class. Combat is a hit/miss for me though.7/10PROS:- Gameplay is fun and involved. 1-on-1 with bosses feel good. Dodging is somewhat required when you're in a even leveled field. - Cutscene animations are great and fluid.- Leveling up is relatively easy, with instance dungeons rewarding extra loot and gear.- You can solo all instances and continue the main quest with no problem.- Instances load quickly.- It's been F2P to level 21, so I assume it stays F2P onwards.CONS:- Another boring storyline. Girl gets kidnapped. Hoo boy what fun.- Environments are bland and boring. Few colors and textures.- Key bindings are static and cannot be changed.- For more hardcore players, this may be too easy.- NPC characters are forgettable.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
												Dragon Nest is a gem among MMORPGs. The game sports an incredibly satisfying combat system that never gets dull whilst you slice and dice through thousands of mobs. I haven't played all of the classes yet, but the ones I have played are all equally entertaining and flashy. Hit up your weeb friends and play it with them because if you play alone you'll probably get sick and tired of grinding dungeons solo. Either that or make some new friends with the... colorful players that also play on their lonesome. Guilds are also a thing, join my guild. Apply to the Poot Empire! POOT POOT!The story had me captivated at first but quickly became too convoluded to be worth reading through so I just skip all that nonsense. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												Dragon Nest incorporates non-targeting system gameplay to create a fast paced action filled experience. Players choose from a range of hero classes, characters that are of the Dragon Nest storyline that can equip customizable gear and weapons. Characters exist in one world, Kalahan, which resulted from Nexon uniting all four worlds to unite the characters. Devastating skills can also be learned, to increase one's power when defeating monsters in instanced dungeons or defeating other players in PVP.Dragon Nest also has the advantage of being nearly completely skill-based, with lower level characters being able to defeat high level characters in PVP with skill alone. This allows a more experienced player that is of a lower level to dominate a less experienced player of a higher level player in PVP. I highly recommend Dragon Nest to all you hardcore players!

content:
Posted: December 9, 2016
												So I am not quite sure what happened to this game in Nexon, did they sell the game to steam or something? The voice over definitely changed when I last played this game. Also I am not quite sure what the max level a character can go in this game. Last time I played it is 50 but apparently one of the gifts shows that I have to be 90+ to open the gift. Some of the contents are still in Korean, don't really know when they are going to fix that.Do I still recommend this game? Hell yea, despite the game is old and even blade and soul (which is released in 2012 as well) beats it by a mile, this is still a fun game with a lot of memories.I started playing this game once it was released, at the time it is still running by Nexon, and the max level was either 45 or 50 I can't remember. I was with a bunch of friends and it was definitely hella of fun back then. I quitted in the summer of 2013 because of some life changes, I haven't played it since then, at least in my memory because it does appear I have 5.5 hours of previous game play on the record.I played the game for couple hours yesterday, I found there are a few players in the game, of course it wasn't like the old days where tons of people were in the Carderock Pass, but seeing new players (or veteran players coming back) is definitely awesome. If you like a game that has a fun storyline, you probably want to find another game; however, if you like the kind of games that are simply fun to play, DN is okay. Or if your computer is kinda poopy on specs, DN is fine to play as well. My old laptop which was complete poop on the specs can still play the game with absolutely no problem.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 22, 2013
												As someone who's played DN for well over 5 years, I was both sorely disappointed and infuriated with the company 'switch.' I'd spent a good deal of money on Dragon Vault items, leveled over 10 characters, and spent a combined ttal of over 800 hours (including before DN was on Steam) in game. Then, Nexon just decided to DROP the game. No warning through emails, no kiss my♥♥♥♥♥ no nothing. Just account deleted when I went to log on. I lost everything. I am too furious at the horrible customer service and the way they just decided to pretty much screw over all their old players. How hard is it to port accounts? Seriously. I played FFXIV and they kept all my data over the years despite not playing for years on end.Honestly, can't recommend this game to anyone anymore. Go play Guild Wars, WoW or Final Fantasy XIV if you want a good fantasy MMO game. And a company that won't delete all your data because they're too lazy to port.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 7, 2016
												I'm very fond of this RPG. The combat: exciting, soft, and fluid, yet still leaves me seeing the skill involved when executing my abilties in seamless succession. Equally as exciting as the combat [I've come to find out] is the dialouge.  Humor takes up a sizable spot to keep me smiling. Some scripts I re-read cause they were so amusing.  I don't have alot of hours in this RPG. But I'll log it to keep you and myself reminded- This is an RPG to stick around for. I wasn't sure when I read a review of someone saying, "The longer you play the better it gets." Doesn't that go with just about any game? But he was right.  This artstyle, and -this may sound weird, but the running avatar running animations, it just looked a little "weird" to me. But weird is simply something I'm just not use to seeing. I've sincerly grown to appreciate what Eyedentity Studios did and see why they did it.  The first day I played this game I knew it had potential, but I wasn't really impressed buy the standards I've been use to for so long.  Same games over and over by different companies had left me subconciously tunnel minded.  This game pryed it back open to how I remember MMORPG's and games being alike. Unique.I wrote this review at 15hours and I'm currently level 32. That being said; the sense of adventure to be had, and fun, isn't nearly over for me.  If a reader will take anything from this review then take this:Stick around and you will not regret it. I promise.

content:
Posted: January 3
												Man oh man... I used to play this a lot... Note my hours (and thats just on steam - DN wasn't always available on the steam client). Definitely still has some of the best and most fluid, fast paced action oriented combat you'll find in ANY MMO, however the community has died down and this one is on its last leg. Now don't get me wrong, its still very fun to play and they've recently switched publishers from NEXON back to the original game developers, tbh I haven't touched it in a while and it kind of died on me. I had a great guild, great friend (whom I still talk to to this day) and a great time in PvP - to be honest I now find myself searching for a newer game to hold my interest like this one did and I still haven't quite found that. So it holds an irreplacable spot in my heart and its definitely a great game! I encourage people to try it casually, though its not really as hardcore as it used to be. I could go into technicalities all day but that'll take a book. Been playing since beta days and now its time to quit. Good luck all!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19
												I will preface this with the TL;DR: I love this game because of the story and the beautiful characters and playability, not because of other players. 4.5/5 stars!Most MMOs come with the near-requirement to have other players helping you. You need a party to take on the swarms of evil. Not so much with DN; If you play smart and don't get too in over your head, you can almost play the entire game without having to join another player. But definitely bring them for Nests and events and raids.Pros:-Good, creative story with fun, if not overly unique, twists and turns. Avoids being too edgy or trying too hard to be funny.-Varying classes with cool customizations. Nothing overly flashy, but weapons look cool and skills are big.-Bright world with varying environments, many enemies to mow down, and wild bosses to fight.-SOLO PLAYER CAPABLE!!! So long as you pace yourself and invest in skills and timing enough, you can 100% solo the majority of the game and not have to rely on other players!Cons:-The story has some obvious twists, and there is a constant up-down with emotions (if you invest in the characters).-The Lassie effect is horrible. You are told how you react, rather than reacting for yourself.-Some NPC that are unbearable stick around WAY too long.-Some of the class stories are confusing and only add questions, instead of answer them, over time.
